Sometimes a person incurred a liability to compensate in case of loss accruing to the other party even upon a mere consilium ; e. g. where by special contract he expressly undertoolr responsibility for his advice, and where the advice was given with evil intent, for the very purpose of damaging the other: ‘consilii non fraudulenti nulla obligatio est: ceterum si dolus et calliditas intercessit, de dolo actio competit' Dig. 42. r. 47. pr. r cf. the text, ‘nemo ex consilio mandati tenetur!
